title: KIM SWITCH / FORTRESS ACCIDENT
description: Kim talks to you about Fortress Accident.

dialogueTree.title: You: ""It's obvious -- this is what remai..."
dialogueTree.text: "It's obvious -- this is what remains of Soona's radio game studio, Fortress Accident."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, I got that." The lieutenant s..."
links.text: "Yes, I got that." The lieutenant shifts on his feet. "What I meant was -- what were they trying to achieve with this damn game..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What were their ambitions? Because..."
links.text: "What were their ambitions? Because this here looks rather *advanced*."

links.title: Empathy: "He has respect -- and curiosity --..."
links.text: He has respect -- and curiosity -- for this failed endeavour.

links.title: Conceptualization: "He's right. This wasn't your grandm..."
links.text: He's right. This wasn't your grandma's game studio, this is something else.

links.title: You: ""You're right, this isn't just a pe..."
links.text: "You're right, this isn't just a pen-and-paper role-playing game. They were trying to make it on *radiocomputers*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Precisely!" He agrees. "It's absol..."
links.text: "Precisely!" He agrees. "It's absolutely mad -- an *automated* role-playing game."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "And I don't use the *mad* lightly,..."
links.text: And I don't use the *mad* lightly, he thinks.

links.title: You: ""I don't know, I'm not an artist.""
links.text: "I don't know, I'm not an artist."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay, well, *I* think..." The lieu..."
links.text: "Okay, well, *I* think..." The lieutenant takes a step back, steepling his hands.

links.title: Interfacing: "Like he's ready to lay out a fine t..."
links.text: Like he's ready to lay out a fine theory, crafted together like a puzzle box.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It looks like one of those popular..."
links.text: "It looks like one of those popular pen-and-paper role-playing games -- only these people were trying to *automate* it. Make it work on *radiocomputers*."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Utter madness, he thinks -- as a co..."
links.text: Utter madness, he thinks -- as a compliment.

links.title: Conceptualization: "This is *way* above your tiny littl..."
links.text: This is *way* above your tiny little policeman head.

dialogueTree.title: You: ""Someone tried to exorcise *the cur..."
dialogueTree.text: "Someone tried to exorcise *the curse* using technology?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, that's not it. *I* think..." T..."
links.text: "No, that's not it. *I* think..." The lieutenant takes a step back, steepling his hands.

links.title: Interfacing: "Like he's ready to lay out a fine t..."
links.text: Like he's ready to lay out a fine theory, crafted together like a puzzle box.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It looks like one of those popular..."
links.text: "It looks like one of those popular pen-and-paper role-playing games -- only these people were trying to *automate* it. Make it work on *radiocomputers*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And by 'these people' I mean peopl..."
links.text: "And by 'these people' I mean people in Soona's radio game company -- Fortress Accident."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Utter madness, he thinks -- as a co..."
links.text: Utter madness, he thinks -- as a compliment.

links.title: You: ""How were they planning to do that?""
links.text: "How were they planning to do that?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Through call-in stations." He nods..."
links.text: "Through call-in stations." He nods at the fireplace. "None of the players have to be physically present... Anyone in the world can participate in the game, as long as they have a two-way radio."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Then there's the Game Master Frequ..."
links.text: "Then there's the Game Master Frequency that listens in on the smaller call-in stations. I think that was supposed to coordinate the stories. Functioning as a master of ceremonies of sorts."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "His fascination has swept aside oth..."
links.text: His fascination has swept aside other concerns for the moment. He's a little *hooked*.

links.title: Interfacing: "Coordinating so many games would ta..."
links.text: Coordinating so many games would take a whole switchboard of people, possibly divided into sub-frequencies.

links.title: You: ""Has anyone ever done this before?""
links.text: "Has anyone ever done this before?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Not to my knowledge. They make aut..."
links.text: "Not to my knowledge. They make automated games in Graad, Messina, Königstein... You know, places with industry."

links.title: Rhetoric: "*Not* in Revachol West, among the r..."
links.text: *Not* in Revachol West, among the ruins.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""But I don't think *anyone* has att..."
links.text: "But I don't think *anyone* has attempted to create an *interisolary* game before. We just don't have the technology."

links.title: You: ""And this was a role-playing game?""
links.text: "And this was a role-playing game?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Indeed. Those *welkins* are a dead..."
links.text: "Indeed. Those *welkins* are a dead giveaway." He points to the chalkboard. "Role-playing people love that stuff. The world looks like a modified version of the Wirrâl boardgame... with heat death thrown in."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Super cool! Someone should give the..."
links.text: Super cool! Someone should give them millions of reál *immediately*. This game is too good to be left unfinished.

links.title: You: ""What do you think happened to the..."
links.text: "What do you think happened to the company?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No idea... They stopped filling ou..."
links.text: "No idea... They stopped filling out the schedule on the chalkboard."

links.title: You: ""Wow." (Conclude.)"
links.text: "Wow." (Conclude.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Indeed. It's ambitious. And *untet..."
links.text: "Indeed. It's ambitious. And *untethered* from reality, but..." The lieutenant tilts his head, thinking.

links.title: You: ""They were insane if they thought t..."
links.text: "They were insane if they thought they could do this."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes -- especially in here." The li..."
links.text: "Yes -- especially in here." The lieutenant looks around the derelict room. The pipes howl and a rat crosses the floor in front of your feet.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay," he concludes. "Let's keep m..."
links.text: "Okay," he concludes. "Let's keep moving."

links.title: You: ""It was just a play to cheat money..."
links.text: "It was just a play to cheat money out of their investor's pockets."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't think so. I think they gen..."
links.text: "I don't think so. I think they genuinely believed..." The lieutenant looks around the derelict room. The pipes howl and a rat crosses the floor.

links.title: You: ""The curse got them, I see no other..."
links.text: "The curse got them, I see no other explanation."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ah yes, the *doom* of bad business..."
links.text: "Ah yes, the *doom* of bad business practices..." The lieutenant looks around the derelict room. The pipes howl and a rat crosses the floor.

links.title: You: ""The world is cold and lonely. This..."
links.text: "The world is cold and lonely. This would keep it company. Let's *finish* it."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "A half-smile breaks out on his face..."
links.text: A half-smile breaks out on his face. "It's too late for that, I'm afraid," he says, looking around the derelict room. The pipes howl and a rat crosses the floor.

links.title: You: ""Do we have any *money*? Let's give..."
links.text: "Do we have any *money*? Let's give them more money so they can finish it and make it even bigger."

dialogueTree.title: You: ""It's just a failed business. The o..."
dialogueTree.text: "It's just a failed business. The only question is -- what the hell were they making?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, that *is* the question..." Th..."
links.text: "Yes, that *is* the question..." The lieutenant takes a step back, steepling his hands.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Got you.""
links.text: "Got you."
